situations.title: Rohan’s Workload
situations.background: Rohan is 24 and recently joined a training program preparing him for entry-level roles. Over the past week, he has been assigned several tasks. Some of the expectations are unclear, and his workload is steadily increasing.

questions.text: When Rohan receives a task with unclear expectations, what is he most likely to do first?

options.C: Complete what he can and explain later
options.D: Wait until more details are provided

questions.text: If Rohan feels his workload is becoming too heavy, what would he most likely do?

options.A: Take on everything and manage somehow
options.D: Feel stressed but not say anything

questions.text: If one task turns out to be harder than expected, how is Rohan likely to respond?

options.B: Ask for support and keep working

questions.text: When instructions are not very clear, how comfortable is Rohan asking questions?
If Rohan realises mid-way that his plan is not working, what does he usually do?
How likely is Rohan to complete tasks even when no one checks on his progress?

situations.title: Aisha’s Learning Experience
situations.background: Aisha is 27 and is taking an online course to improve her job prospects. She enjoys learning but sometimes wonders how useful the content will be in real work situations.

questions.text: After learning something new, what is Aisha most likely to do?

options.A: Try using it in a real situation
options.D: Move on to the next topic

questions.text: What helps Aisha remember what she learns best?
If learning feels difficult, what keeps Aisha going?
When learning feels disconnected from real life, how does Aisha respond?
How likely is Aisha to experiment with what she learns?

situations.title: Sameer at Work
situations.background: Sameer is 31 and works in a small team. Discussions sometimes become emotionally charged, especially when deadlines are tight and opinions differ.

questions.text: When someone reacts emotionally, how does Sameer usually respond?

options.A: Stay calm and focus on solutions

questions.text: During disagreements, what helps Sameer most?
When feedback is shared in a tense moment, how is Sameer most likely to take it?
How does Sameer usually work with teammates who think differently from him?
